title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.34 | 02-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandhasiya Gyananjani Shalakaya
Chaksharunmelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshthaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 34th verse of the 8th chapter
of the 1st canto.
Srimad Bhagavatam
Continuing the prayers by Queen Kunti
The meaning of this verse is
Others say that the world being overburdened like a boat at sea
is much aggrieved
and that Brahma who is your son prayed for you
and so you have appeared to diminish the trouble
so yet one more reason why Krishna appeared
Krishna had appeared
Krishna had incarnated
and all these reasons are valid reasons
so the Lord is so expert
but that
when he appears for
apparently one purpose
actually he
solves so many problems
all these problems are valid reasons
all the problems of all the people that's the Lord's way of incarnation so
here another reason is being given that Brahma he felt that the earth was
overburdened by demoniac forces and he was unable to deal with it so he prayed
for the Lord's incarnation and the Lord appeared to diminish this burden so in
the purport Srila Prabhupada explains Brahma or the first living being born
just after the creation is the direct son of Narayana Narayana as Garbhodakashayi
Vishnu Garbhodakashayi Vishnu is a form of Narayana incarnating as Vishnu as the
second Vishnu form in this world
Garbhodakashayi Vishnu first of all this Vishnu enters the material universe why
because without spiritual contact matter cannot create we think that material
changes are taking place automatically no nothing happens automatically
behind matter there has to be spirit so Srila Prabhupada says without spiritual
contact matter cannot create this principle was followed from the very
beginning of the creation the supreme spirit that is the supreme Lord entered
the universe
and the first living being Brahma was born on a lotus flower grown out of the
transcendental abdomen of Vishnu Garbhodakashayi Vishnu has got a lotus like
depression in his navel region from that
Lotus navel a lotus flower was born therefore he is called Padmanabha
what I've heard this name Padmanabha he from whose navel nabi or nabha Padma a
lotus appeared Brahma was born on that Lotus so Srila Prabhupada says Vishnu is
also known therefore as Padmanabha Brahma is known as Atma Bhuvu because he
was begotten directly from the father without any contact of mother Lakshmi ji

Brahma is also known therefore as Padmanabha Brahma is known as Atma Bhuvu because he was begotten directly from the father without any contact of Mother Lakshmi ji without any contact of Mother Lakshmi ji
Vishnu's consort is Lakshmi. Generally anybody takes birth from a father and mother. That's our experience in this world.
But Brahma, he was born directly from the father without any contact with the mother.
Srila Prabhupada explains, Lakshmiji was present near Narayana engaged in the service of Lord Narayana.
And still without contact with Lakshmiji, Narayana begot Brahma.
So, therefore Srila Prabhupada says, this is the omnipotency of Lord Narayana.
Omnipotency means he is the father.
He has got all power, all kinds of potencies.
And those potencies are working. They are active.
Actively engaged in producing so many different changes.
One who foolishly considers Narayana like other living beings should take a lesson from this.
There are so many millions and billions of living beings including powerful devatas.
But no devata can produce a son without contact between the male and female.
Not possible. Never happens.
Therefore, the conclusion is, Narayana is not an ordinary being.
Narayana is not an ordinary living being.
Especially the mayavadis.
They wrongly think or consider everyone is Narayana.
So, between sanyasis, they address each other as Narayana.
When one mayavadi sanyasi meets another mayavadi sanyasi, he says,
Namo Narayana.
So, he is addressing the other sanyasi as Narayana.
Then the other sanyasi will also address this first sanyasi as Narayana.
This is blasphemy.
Because Narayana is not an ordinary living being.
Ordinary living being can never become Narayana.
Narayana never becomes conditioned.
In this material world, Narayana never accepts a material body.
So, these mayavadis who accepted a material body,
it is because they are jiva.
They are ordinary living being.
Living being is subject to bewilderment by the illusory energy.
Living being has to be, may be forced to take birth and accept a material body.
But Krishna does not take such birth.
Krishna does not accept material body.
Narayana is always transcendental.
So, the conclusion or the proper understanding is that
Narayana is the personality of God in himself.
And he has all the potencies of all the senses
in all the parts of his transcendental body.
So,
This is statement in the Brahma Samhita.
As regards the Supreme Personality of God,
Brahma Samhita states,
His different parts of the body
are capable of doing the work of all other parts.
Each part or each sense can act,
and perform the activities of all other senses.
Just like Narayana can eat by seeing through his eyes.
We can only see with our eyes.
We cannot eat with our eyes.
We cannot see with our mouth.
We can only eat with our mouth.
Like that.
So,
Srila Prabhupada explains,
An ordinary living being begets a child by sexual intercourse.
And he has no other means to beget a child other than the one designed for him.
But Narayana being omnipotent is not bound to any condition of energy.
Supreme Lord Narayana.
He is complete and independent to do anything and everything by his various potencies.
Very easily and perfectly.
Everything the Lord does,
through his energies,
through his potencies,
easily and perfectly.
Just by his will,
things happen.
That's all.
Nothing more.
And whatever he does,
he does it perfectly.
Brahma is therefore directly the son of the father,
and was not put into the womb of a mother,
therefore Brahma is called Atma Bhuv,
self-born.
Because he doesn't have a mother.
Brahma doesn't have a mother.
Doesn't enter a womb of a mother.
No.
This Brahma,
who is thus created by Narayana,
without any contact
with the woman.
This Brahma
is in charge of further creations in the universe.
Further creations in the universe.
So the initial work of creation is done by Vishnu.
But afterwards,
after Brahma is born,
Brahma does the further work of creation.
And Prabhupada explains here,
secondarily reflected by the potency of the omnipotent.
What is the meaning of this?
That Brahma does further work of creation.
Like Brahma creates the Prajapatis.
Now that is also
due to the potency of the Supreme Lord,
which is invested in Brahma
to do the further creation.
If Brahma were not empowered by Narayana,
Brahma could not create.
If Brahma were not empowered,
he could not create.
Within the halo of the universe,
there is a transcendental planet known as Shwetadvipa,
which is the abode of the Kshirodakashaya Vishnu.
This is the third Vishnu form.
Kshirodakashaya Vishnu.
He is residing in a planet
called Shwetadvipa,
in which there is a milk ocean,
and in the center of the milk ocean,
there is an island.
On that island,
the Lord resides at Kshirodakashaya Vishnu,
the maintainer Vishnu
of this whole universe.
Whenever there is trouble in the universe
that cannot be solved by the administrative demigods,
they approach Brahma.
And if Brahma also cannot solve their problem,
then Brahma consults and prays to
Kshirodakashaya Vishnu,
the maintainer Vishnu.
So when Kamsa and others were giving trouble,
then earth became overburdened
by the misdeeds of these demoniac people.
So Brahma, along with the other devatas,
prayed at the shore of the Kshirodaka ocean.
And they were advised
that the Supreme Lord himself
is going to descend in his avatar as Krishna.
And they also knew that Krishna would appear
as the son of Vasudeva and Devaki.
So therefore, some people say
the Lord appeared because of the prayers of Brahmaji.
Brahma prayed. It's a fact.
Brahma prayed.
And he got the response from the Lord
within his heart
that the Supreme Lord himself
will personally appear in the Yadu dynasty
as the son of Vasudeva and Devaki.
Therefore, when Krishna appeared
in the womb of Devaki,
then the devatas came to pray
to Krishna within the womb of Devaki.
It's called Garbhasthuti prayers.
Tenth canto, second chapter.
Beautiful prayers are there
which are offered by the demigods
to Krishna in the womb of Devaki.
They knew because Brahma was informed.
So I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Thank you.
